meanings.definition: The highest point or part of something.
meanings.sent1: The topstones of the mountain were covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: She reached the topstones of the tree after climbing for hours.
meanings.sent3: The topstones of the cake were decorated with colorful icing.
meanings.sent4: His ambition was to reach the topstones of success in his career.
meanings.sent5: The castle's topstones gleamed in the sunlight, visible from afar.

meanings.definition: A stone placed on top of another stone to form a structure.
meanings.sent1: The builders carefully placed the topstones to create a sturdy wall.
meanings.sent2: The children stacked the topstones to build a small tower in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel knocked over the topstones of the rock pile.
meanings.sent4: She balanced the topstones precariously, creating a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins still had some topstones intact, showcasing the craftsmanship.

meanings.definition: The uppermost part of a wall or building.
meanings.sent1: The topstones of the castle were adorned with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the topstones of the tower to be ornate and grand.
meanings.sent3: A bird perched on the topstones of the church, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The ivy climbed up the walls, reaching the topstones of the old mansion.
meanings.sent5: The rainwater cascaded down from the topstones during the storm.
